alert.note: Alert for Henry; Oldham; Trimble (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:33AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, eastern Clark, northeastern Floyd, Oldham, Trimble and Henry Counties through 515 AM EST... At 432 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Dillsboro to 7 miles west of New Albany. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts between 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Jefferson, northeastern Floyd and eastern Clark Counties in south central Indiana, Oldham, Henry and Trimble Counties in north central Kentucky, including the following locations... Campbellsburg, Manville, Clark Siding, Buckner, Watson, Floyds Knobs, Ballardsville, Smithfield, Owen and Paynesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
